user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of parse_bauth_params:
```c
static bool
parse_bauth_params (const char *str,
                    size_t str_len,
                    struct MHD_RqBAuth *pbauth)
{
  size_t i;

  i = 0;

  /* Skip all whitespaces at start */
  while (i < str_len && (' ' == str[i] || '\t' == str[i]))
    i++;

  if (str_len > i)
  {
    size_t token68_start;
    size_t token68_len;

    /* 'i' points to the first non-whitespace char after scheme token */
    token68_start = i;
    /* Find end of the token. Token cannot contain whitespace. */
    while (i < str_len && ' ' != str[i] && '\t' != str[i])
    {
      if (0 == str[i])
        return false;  /* Binary zero is not allowed */
      if ((',' == str[i]) || (';' == str[i]))
        return false;  /* Only single token68 is allowed */
      i++;
    }
    token68_len = i - token68_start;
    mhd_assert (0 != token68_len);

    /* Skip all whitespaces */
    while (i < str_len && (' ' == str[i] || '\t' == str[i]))
      i++;
    /* Check whether any garbage is present at the end of the string */
    if (str_len != i)
      return false;
    else
    {
      /* No more data in the string, only single token68. */
      pbauth->token68.str = str + token68_start;
      pbauth->token68.len = token68_len;
    }
  }
  return true;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
if ((',' == str[i]) || (';' == str[i]))
        return false;  /* Only single token68 is allowed */

if (0 == str[i])
        return false;  /* Binary zero is not allowed */
explanation: The rest of the function contains the main parsing loops and straightforward boundary checks (initial whitespace skip, token scanning loop condition while (i < str_len && ' ' != str[i] && '\t' != str[i]) { ... i++; }, trailing whitespace skip, final equality check and assignment to pbauth->token68). Those constructs are normal parsing logic and are reachable for appropriate inputs (e.g., when str_len > i the token-scanning and following branches execute; when str_len == i the function returns true). Therefore they do not need investigation for unreachable-code concerns. The three selected fragments are flagged because their conditions/uses can be invariant or dependent on how str_len is provided (for example, if str_len was derived from strlen(str) some checks like embedded NUL detection become impossible, and the assert documents an invariant that may be compiled out), so they deserve inspection to ensure no unreachable code is present and the assumptions about str and str_len are valid.
